history.content:
61C+70+16B is NOT even a "possible" combination due to the incredible workload. If you haven't learn the material before, please select only two from the three. Maybe 61A+16B and then 61B+70 would be a fair work load for new transfers. Note 1 unit in lower EECS classes at Cal comes with more workload than 1 unit in most of other classes, and it's possible near 2 or 3 times more workload than 1 unit at CC (assuming you are pursuing >3.5 gpa).

--

None of these schedules are manageable. I would highly recommend taking a lighter workload for your first semester at Cal, so you can understand what classes are like here first. In addition, look into getting involved in student organizations. I understand that you completed your Math and GE requirements, but I wasn't aware that you can bypass the American Cultures requirement (thought that you had to take the class here in Berkeley). Consider the following schedule instead:

Fall 2018: CS 61A, EE 16A, <insert-light-workload or P/NP class here>, Decal

Spring 2019 [Not worried about meeting the 3.3 GPA]: CS 61B, CS 70, <insert-light-workload or P/NP class here>, Decal

Spring 2019 [Worried about meeting the 3.3 GPA cap]: CS 61B, EE 16B, <insert-light-workload or P/NP class here>, Decal

While I am not a transfer student, I am a CS Peer Advisor, and I've spoken to many transfer students about their schedules.

--

I'm a transfer myself. Some suggestions:

- consider taking summer classes if possible (say CS61A)

- assuming you've taken linear algebra in CC, instead of doing EE16A you can do EE47D (I did it), 2-unit version where you'll skip about 6 weeks of homework and lectures and first midterm. It might be a good option to get into Cal's classes' pace.

- I'd say that 1 tech unit at Cal is like 3 units in CC, at least, that what it feels like, so plan accordingly

- you need to get 3.3 GPA to declare, and unless you're a very bright kid with a lot of experience in CS already, it's going to be hard, so I'd recommend a plan that my friend, also CC transfer, follows: Summer CS61A; Fall CS61B, EE16A, tech elective; Spring CS70, EE16B, tech elective

--

Not a transfer student, but I took 61C + 70 + 16B + history breadth and it was not worth it. I feel like I would have gotten a lot more out of the classes had I stuck with just two of the three in a semester.

61C+70+16B is NOT even a "possible" combination due to the incredible workload. If you haven't learn the material before, please select only two from the three. Maybe 61A+16B and then 61B+70 would be a fair work load for new transfers. Note 1 unit in lower EECS classes at Cal comes with more workload than 1 unit in most of other classes, and it's possible near 2 or 3 times more workload than 1 unit at CC (assuming you are pursuing >3.5 gpa).

For anyone who transferred from CC in CS L&S intended major, please share your course plan for the first two or three semesters here at Cal.

Here's my plan:

Fall 2018: CS 61A, CS 61B, EE 16A (P/NP), Decal

Spring 2019: CS 61C, CS 70, EE 16B, Decal

I'd like to know about the course load and the planning, especially from anyone who still needed to take CS 61A, 61B, 61C, 70 and EE 16A, EE 16B. I've finished Math and GE requirements at CC. Thanks!
history.subject: Transfer CS L&S Intended Course Plan and Suggestions
